metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39173 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description: In wolfSSL before 5.5.1, malicious clients can cause a buffer overflowduring a TLS 1.3 handshake. This occurs when an attacker supposedly resumesa previous TLS session. During the resumption Client Hello a Hello RetryRequest must be triggered. Both Client Hellos are required to contain alist of duplicate cipher suites to trigger the buffer overflow. In total,two Client Hellos have to be sent: one in the resumed session, and a secondone as a response to a Hello Retry Request message.

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
